{"step_by_step_thinking": "A tertiary monoblock system of obturation of the root canal refers to a system where the sealer, core, and canal wall are fused together to form a single unit. Resilon monoblock obturation is a system that uses a synthetic polymer-based root canal filling material (Resilon) and a dual-cure resin sealer (Epiphany) to achieve this. Active Gutta percha, Orthograde obturation with MTA, and Gutta Percha and AH plus sealer are not monoblock systems as they do not form a single unit with the canal wall.", "answer_choice": "A"}
